III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the
following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was allegedly touched on her breast by Supervisor 1
when Supervisor 1 attempted to take off Youth A's bra as a safety
measure.
Investigation The complainant was interviewed on 09/01/2023 and had no
further information to provide.
On 09/01/2023 the Chief Administrator confirmed Supervisor 1
was removed from working in the units directly with youth for the
initiation of this investigation.
Youth A was interviewed on 09/15/2023 with DHHS Worker 1 and
Law enforcement over video conference with a child advocacy
center. Youth A recalled the incident in question where Supervisor
1 touched her inappropriately. Youth A stated this happened
during a restraint, and she believed it was sexual abuse. Youth A
stated Supervisor 1 was in the process of taking off Youth A‘s bra
when Supervisor 1 touched the left upper and right lower part of
Youth A‘s breast. Youth A believed this happened three times.
Youth A believed Staff 6 was around, but that no other youth were
around to witness this. She also believed this may have happened
in her unit. Youth A could not recall exactly when this incident
occurred, only that it was in the fall of 2022. Youth A stated she
told Supervisor 1 to stop touching her during the incident. Youth A
stated there were no other times when she was touched
inappropriately by staff.
Youth B was interviewed on 10/06/2023 with DHHS Worker 1
over video conference. Youth B recalled being placed in a unit at
the facility with Youth A. She stated that she did not recall Youth
A‘s clothes being taken off of her during an incident like the one
2

alleged. She did recall a safety plan where Youth A was not
allowed to have sweatshirts or pants at times because Youth B
had heard Youth A talk about using those for self harm. Youth B
went on to state that she may have seen a staff member remove
Youth A‘s bra, but this may have been involving Youth E. She
could not recall who this staff member was. Youth B remembered
that someone had to have their bra cut off because they were
trying to hurt themselves with it. Youth B believed that this may
have been Staff 8 or Supervisor 1 who were the staff involved.
Youth B recalled one of the staff members, she could not
remember who, stating to Youth A “If you’re going to try to choke
yourself, we have to take your bra away.” Youth B believed she
saw the entirety of this incident and she never saw anyone touch
or grab Youth A‘s breast.
Youth C was interviewed on 10/09/2023 over video conference
with DHHS Worker 1. She stated she was placed in a unit with
Youth A during her time at the facility. Youth C stated she saw one
restraint involving Supervisor 1 and Youth A that was similar to
what has been alleged. Youth C recalled Youth A was attempting
to harm herself and staff had to cut off her clothes in an attempt to
keep her safe. Youth C recalled the staff members being involved
were Supervisor 1, Staff 1, and Staff 5. Youth C stated that staff
had tried to verbally de-escalate Youth A several times and had to
talk to her about the prospect of removing her clothes because of
safety concerns. Youth C recalled seeing specific safety scissors
being used by Supervisor 1 and Youth A‘s pants were cut first and
then her bra was cut off of her body while her shirt was still on.
Youth C recalled Youth A was highly escalated during the entirety
of this incident, and that towards the end, she heard Youth A say
“I’m going to call CPS and tell them you touched me.” Youth C
remembered hearing Staff 5 say in response “You know she didn’t
touch you.” Youth C believed that Supervisor 1 let Youth A call
authorities at that point. Overall, Youth C stated she never saw
Supervisor 1 touch Youth A inappropriately.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed during an announced face-to-face
visit at the facility with DHHS Worker 1 on 10/13/2023. She
recalled one specific instance, unknown date, where she was
involved in a restraint with Youth A that rose to the level of
clothing having to be removed. Supervisor 1 described Youth A at
that point in time as highly escalated, and there was concern that
she was going to use anything she could to harm herself.
Supervisor 1 stated that she and other staff heard Youth A state
she would use her own clothing to choke herself if given the
chance. Supervisor 1 recalled a safety plan already existed for
3

Youth A surrounding what types of clothing she could have.
Supervisor 1 stated her first interaction with Youth A that day was
when Supervisor 1 was called in after Youth A stated she wanted
to hang herself in the bathroom with her bra. Supervisor 1 recalled
calling Therapist 1 to discuss how to handle the situation and
Therapist 1 informed Supervisor 1 that Youth A would need to
have her bra removed. Supervisor 1 stated she went to the med
cart to get the “cut down” tool. Supervisor 1 described this as a
pair of safety scissors that has a wide bottom piece to avoid
someone accidentally being cut when it is being used. Supervisor
1 stated Youth A was yelling about having to go to the bathroom,
and no one was going to touch her or try to remove her clothes.
Supervisor 1 recalled Youth A was then trying to climb up the
cubbies that are located on the outside wall of the bathroom and
this caused an unsafe situation as they could easily tip over or
Youth A could have fallen off of them. Supervisor 1 stated she
was with Staff 3 and they attempted a standing restraint to help
Youth A get back to the ground. Supervisor 1 stated the standing
restraint almost immediately went down to the floor when Youth A
dropped her weight. Supervisor 1 recalled there was a third staff
member that she could not name, then involved with them and a
team restraint was utilized. Supervisor 1 recalled Youth A was
laying on her back and screaming and thrashing at them when
she attempted to cut off some of Youth A’s clothing. Supervisor 1
stated that she was able to cut the top straps of Youth A‘s bra
without Youth A‘s shirt being removed. Supervisor 1 stated she
then reached under Youth A's shirt and grabbed the front portion
of the now cut bra to quickly “shimmy” it down Youth A‘s
midsection. Supervisor 1 stated the restraint was able to end as
soon as they removed the bra, and that it did not last any longer
than five minutes. Supervisor 1 recalled Youth A then committing
to safety. She believed Youth A may have ran out of the unit after
that point, but could not specifically recall. Overall, Supervisor 1
stated Youth A was never pushed by staff, nor was she restrained
outside of the unit during the incident in question. Supervisor 1 did
recall Youth A saying in the moment “you raped me” as the bra
was being cut off. Supervisor 1 reiterated that she never touched
Youth A inappropriately during the restraint. She did comment that
it was hectic and chaotic and unique in that clothing was being cut
off, but she believed that this portion of the incident was able to
occur as staff intended, which was to keep Youth A‘s shirt on and
remove the bra from the top down to avoid any touching.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed again over the phone with DHHS
Worker 1 on 12/07/2023. Supervisor 1 reiterated that the incident
in question only involved the cutting off of Youth A’s bra and
4

nothing inappropriate had occurred. She denied touching Youth A
on the breast, intentionally or unintentionally. Supervisor 1 stated
Youth A was able to have her bra cut off and this occurred without
any other clothing having to be removed.
Staff 1 was interviewed during an announced face-to-face visit at
the facility with DHHS Worker 1 on 10/13/2023. She stated she
could not recall being involved in an incident where a bra had to
be cut off of any youth, let alone Youth A. Staff 1 stated she never
witnessed anything like this either.
Staff 2 was interviewed in person during an announced face-to-
face visit to the facility on 10/13/2023 with DHHS Worker 1. She
stated she could not remember an incident involving Youth A and
a bra having to be cut off.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 10/20/2023 with DHHS Worker 1 over
the phone. She did not recall working in any situations that
involved a bra having to be cut off Youth A or any other youth.
Youth E was interviewed over video conference with DHHS
Worker 1 on 10/27/2023. She recalled being in a unit with Youth A
at the facility. Youth E stated she could not recall any other times
Youth A was restrained by any staff other than witnessing the
incident in question. Youth E believed Youth A took off her own
shirt in the process of trying to hang herself with her bra in the
bathroom. Youth E recalled Supervisor 1 left the unit to call
someone and she came back shortly thereafter, and that is when
staff attempted to take Youth A’s bra. Youth E described this part
of the incident as being done “appropriately.” She recalled staff
asked Youth A if she would give them her bra and Youth A did not
want to do so. She also recalled staff warned that they might have
to go hands-on with Youth A if they did not trust that she could be
safe at that moment. Youth E stated she could not recall exactly
who was speaking with Youth A or who went hands-on to take
Youth A‘s bra off. She believed this was accomplished by staff,
cutting the bra off of Youth A‘s body from the top down. Youth E
did not believe Supervisor 1 ever touched Youth A in an
inappropriate manner. Youth E recalled hearing Youth A state “I’m
going to tell CPS that you touched my breast” and “I’m gonna get
your kids taken away” during the incident. Youth E believed Youth
A never left the unit or ran out of the door. She also never saw
Youth A be slammed to the ground during this incident or any
others.
5

Staff 5 was interviewed over the phone on 10/31/2023 with DHHS
Worker 1. She stated she was never involved in any situation
where Youth A‘s bra had to be cut off and she could not recall if
this happened without her present. Staff 5 also stated she was
never involved in a restraint for Youth A herself and did not
believe this occurred very frequently. She also never saw Youth A
get slammed to the ground.
Youth F was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 over video on
11/02/2023. She stated she was in a unit with Youth A while she
was placed at the facility. She recalled one specific instance that
involved Supervisor 1 and Staff 5. Youth F stated it started with
Youth A acting out and attempting to self harm. Youth F recalled
seeing Youth A trying to bite her own clothing into strips and
stating she wanted to wrap those around her neck. Youth F stated
she saw Youth A‘s bra get cut off and Youth A‘s shirt and shorts
stayed on while they did this. Youth F believed Supervisor 1 cut
off Youth A‘s bra from the back. She also recalled other staff were
involved but they were not touching Youth A at that time. She
could not recall who those staff were. Youth F stated she did not
see anyone touch Youth A‘s breast or do anything that appeared
to be inappropriate during this action. Youth F recalled Supervisor
1 stating “nobody wants to touch your mosquito bites” to Youth A
during the incident. Youth F believed Supervisor 1 grabbed Youth
A by the shirt and “threw her around” while this incident occurred
and that Youth A was fighting back. Youth F stated she never saw
Supervisor 1 do this with any other youth.
Therapist 1 was interviewed on 11/27/2023 over the phone with
DHHS Worker 1. Therapist 1 stated she was not present in person
for the incident in question, but she did recall being involved over
the phone. Therapist 1 stated her involvement was solely
regarding the decision to make efforts to cut off Youth A’s bra
because of the significant threat of self-harm that was presented
in that moment, as well as the decision to take Youth A into the
hospital to be evaluated after the incident de-escalate later in the
night. Therapist 1 confirmed that she gave direction to cut off the
bra of Youth A as a safety precaution.
Youth H was interviewed over video on 11/28/2023 with DHHS
Worker 1. She recalled being placed in the same unit as Youth A
for a time. While in the program, Youth H stated she could not
recall seeing a restraint between Supervisor 1 and Youth A or an
incident where Youth A‘s bra had to be cut off. Youth H denied
ever being involved in a situation where she attempted to hold
Youth A down or got into a physical altercation with Youth A. She
6

also stated that she never saw a fight between Youth D or Youth
A. Youth H recalled hearing about the bra incident, but only that it
occurred and that Youth A had never said anything about feeling
raped or molested.
During a video conference on 01/30/2024 DHHS Worker 1 stated
that their investigation would not produce any findings.
Documents reviewed:
• The personnel file for Supervisor 1 was reviewed. She had
one instance of discipline noted regarding an 11/30/2022
incident where a mistake was made in the administration of
medication.
• Policy titled “Response to Acute Psychiatric Distress:
Suicide Risk Response and Safety Protocols” that was last
revised in 2022 was reviewed. In this policy staff are
directed to “ask youth to “dress down” in simple clothing to
decrease risk: shorts, t-shirt, and flip flops or shoes with
laces removed (weather contingent). All other items of
clothing and hygiene will be temporarily removed from the
client’s room/possession until the Safety Watch is
discontinued.”
• Safety plans for Youth A from the facility from fall 2022 were
reviewed. Of note the 11/11/2022 safety plan described a
safety-based restriction for Youth A as having to “dress
down.”
• An incident report dated 11/06/2022 was reviewed. Of all
the incidents described in this investigation, this incident
report contained the closest information to what was
provided in interviews. In this report Youth A was described
as significantly agitated and providing credible threats of
self-harm. Supervisor 1, Staff 1 and Staff 5 attempted to
verbally de-escalate Youth A to no success. It was decided
that some of her clothing needed to be removed for her own
safety, and in doing so Youth A would not comply and
struggled. Staff decided to remove the bra while attempting
to restrain Youth A. After doing so, Youth A continued to be
upset and threaten self-harm, and it was later decided to
transport her to the local hospital for crisis services.
• An incident report dated 11/04/2022 was also reviewed.
This incident was not discussed in any interviews for this
report, but it contains a description of behavior from Youth A
where there was a paper clip located in the bra of Youth A
that Youth A stated would be used for self-harm.
7

• It was confirmed at the end of DHHS 1 Worker’s
investigation that law enforcement did not pursue charges
against Supervisor 1 for the incident in question.
Analysis Through interviews with youth and staff and documentation
reviewed, there was no evidence found to show that Supervisor 1
inappropriately touched Youth A during an escalated incident in
November 2022.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms
of intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Supervisor 1 physically harmed Youth A during restraints on two
separate occasions.
Investigation Incident 1 – It was alleged that Youth A was slammed to the
ground outside of the unit at the facility by Supervisor 1
Youth A was interviewed on 09/15/2023 with DHHS Worker 1 and
Law enforcement. Youth A recalled another incident where she
believed she was slammed to the ground by Supervisor 1. Youth
A could not recall many specific details of the incident other than
she was outside of the unit and as the incident escalated, a staff
member tripped her. She could not specify who this staff member
was. Youth A stated Supervisor 1 then slammed her to the ground
and attempted to restrain her. Youth A stated she did not feel
injured at the time, but as time passed since the incident, her back
and spine have had frequent pain and she has seen doctors to
assess and receive treatment.
Youth B was interviewed on 10/06/2023 with DHHS Worker 1
over video conference. She stated she never saw Youth A get
slammed to the ground, inside or outside of the unit.
Youth C was interviewed on 10/09/2023 over video conference
with DHHS Worker 1. Youth C did not recall ever seeing Youth A
get slammed to the ground, inside or outside of the unit.
Staff 2 was interviewed in person during an announced face-to-
face visit to the facility on 10/13/2023 with DHHS Worker 1. Staff 2
8

stated she never saw Youth A get shoved to the ground nor did
she see Supervisor 1 do this specifically to Youth A or any other
youth.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 10/20/2023 with DHHS Worker 1 over
the phone. Staff 3 stated she did have to follow Youth A out of the
unit on occasion to provide line of sight when Youth A would
attempt AWOL. She could not recall ever being involved in a time
when Youth A had to be restrained outside or was slammed to the
ground by Supervisor 1 or any other staff.
Staff 5 was interviewed over the phone on 10/31/2023 with DHHS
Worker 1. She stated that she never saw Youth A get slammed to
the ground.
Youth F was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 over video on
11/02/2023. Youth F stated she never saw Supervisor 1 slam
Youth A on the ground outside during any separate incidents.
Youth G was interviewed on 11/02/2023 with DHHS Worker 1
over video. Youth G stated she saw Youth A be restrained
outside of the building on one occasion. She stated this occurred
during dinner time when the unit was in the cafeteria. Youth G
recalled Supervisor 1 standing near the med cart and Youth A
running out of the back door of the dining room. Youth G saw
Supervisor 1 eventually restrain Youth A outside with staff helping,
but she could not recall the names of those staff. Youth G stated
that she did not see Youth A get slammed to the ground when this
occurred.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker
1 on 12/07/2023. Supervisor 1 stated that she did not ever
participate in a restraint incident with Youth A where they were
outside and Youth A was on the ground.
Documents reviewed:
• Youth A received medical attention at her new placement on
10/10/2023 as a result of these allegations. Documentation
provided stated Youth A did not present any concerns for
back or neck pain, and the doctor that performed her
physical exam did not note any concerns.
• Youth A was placed at the facility from 08/05/2022-
03/16/2023. During that time there were 68 documented
incidents of self injurious behavior or physical
managements. None of these incident reports contained a
9

situation where Youth A was restrained on the ground
outside of the building.
Incident 2 – It was alleged that Youth A was pulled out of bed
with force by Supervisor 1
Youth G was interviewed on 11/02/2023 with DHHS Worker 1
over video. She stated she never saw the incident involving Youth
A having her bra cut off her body by staff, but she did hear that it
had occurred. Youth G went on to describe a separate incident
where she believed Supervisor 1 slammed Youth A to the ground.
Youth G stated Youth A was still in bed later in the morning and
was refusing to go to school. Youth G recalled Supervisor 1 ripped
her out of bed because of this, throwing her blankets off her and
pulling her up by her hands. Youth G believed Staff 7 was also
present. Youth G thought Supervisor 1 had Youth A‘s wrist pinned
up against the wall. Youth G cannot recall who else may have
been present or when this may have occurred.
Youth A was interviewed on 11/08/2023 over video with DHHS
Worker 1. She never referenced any times where Supervisor 1
would have physically pulled her out of bed in reference to
questions regarding any other physical incidents between her and
Supervisor 1 other than the original allegation.
Youth I was interviewed on 11/29/2023 over video with DHHS
Worker 1. She stated she saw Supervisor 1 restrain Youth A one
time but could not remember any details. She never heard any
accusations that Youth A was raped or molested by Supervisor 1.
Youth I stated she saw one occasion where Supervisor 1 put her
hands on Youth A to get Youth A out of bed. She believed that
Supervisor 1 pulled the sheets off and grabbed Youth A by the
wrist. Youth I stated this occurred during a time when Youth A was
trying to hurt herself in some form but could not remember any
other details. She did not see Supervisor 1 ever pick Youth A up
or hold her against the wall.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker
1 on 12/07/2023. Supervisor 1 denied there ever being a time
when she grabbed Youth A‘s arm to pull her out of bed. She
recalled several occasions where she was in the unit with Youth A
where Youth A had refused to get out of bed in the morning to go
to school. Supervisor 1 stated she would often try to talk to Youth
A into getting out of bed but denied ever pulling her out or using
any kind of physical force.
10

Documents reviewed:
• Youth A was placed at the facility from 08/05/2022-
03/16/2023. During that time there were 68 documented
incidents of self injurious behavior or physical
managements. None of these incident reports contained a
situation where Youth A was physically managed by
Supervisor 1 as a result of staying in bed.
Analysis Through interviews with youth and staff and documentation
reviewed, there was no evidence found to support a rule violation
of staff using inappropriate force during restraints due to the lack
of clarity on details and inconsistent statements of the alleged
incidents.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Resident restraint
Section (1) A child caring institution, including private secure juvenile
Description justice facilities, shall establish a process improvement
and restraint reduction/elimination plan that:
(a) Includes documentation of each restraint.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth A was restrained frequently and this was not documented
properly.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed on 09/15/2023 with DHHS Worker 1 and
law-enforcement. This occurred through a video conference with
the child advocacy center. She stated she felt like she was
restrained “every day” while placed in the program but could not
provide any specific details on this frequency or individual
occurrences.
Youth A was re-interviewed over video conference with DHHS
Worker 1 on 11/08/2023. She stated that she cannot recall any
other times that she may have been restrained. Youth A stated
there were several occasions where she wanted to harm herself
as well as run away, and that this would frequently result in being
restrained after her behavior escalated.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed during an announced face-to-face
visit at the facility with DHHS Worker 1 on 10/13/2023. Supervisor
1 recalled that Youth A did not have to be restrained much, and
that she did not see anyone else restrain her during her time at
the facility. Supervisor 1 cannot recall any other times when she
was involved in a restraint with Youth A.
Youth E was interviewed over video conference with DHHS
Worker 1 on 10/27/2023. She recalled being in a unit with Youth A
11

at the facility. Youth E stated she could not recall any other times
that Youth A was restrained by any staff other than witnessing the
incident in question.
Staff 5 was interviewed over the phone on 10/31/2023 with DHHS
Worker 1. Staff 5 did not believe that Youth A was restrained very
frequently while she was placed at the facility and stated she did
not participate in any restraints of Youth A herself.
Youth F was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 over video on
11/02/2023. She state she was in a unit with Youth A while she
was placed at the facility. Youth F believed there were times when
Supervisor 1 “threw her around” when referencing Youth A being
restrained. Youth F could only identify the one instance where
Supervisor 1 restrained Youth A and Youth A’s bra had to be cut
off. Past that, she stated she could not remember any other
instances.
Documents reviewed:
• Youth A was placed at the facility from 08/05/2022-
03/16/2023. During that time there were 68 documented
incidents of self injurious behavior or physical
managements.
Analysis Through interviews with youth and staff there was no evidence
found to support a rule violation that Youth A was restrained
excessively or without proper documentation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4131 Compliance with child protection law;
Section development of plan required
Description (1) The licensee shall develop and implement a written plan to
assure compliance with the child protection law, 1975 PA
238, MCL 722.621 to 722.638.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation It was alleged that Youth A was not allowed to make a phone call
to report allegations of abuse by staff at the facility.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed over video conference with DHHS
Worker 1 on 11/08/2023. Regarding her efforts to report the
alleged incident after it occurred, Youth A recalled Supervisor 1
getting upset about Youth A reporting. Youth A recalled
Supervisor 1 saying “I’m not getting in trouble over you.” Youth A
stated she tried to take the phone out of Supervisor 1’s hands as
Supervisor 1 was dialing and that because she initiated physical
contact so aggressively, the situation escalated further. Youth A
12

stated she did not ask to call anyone after that point and she did
not think she ever told her Foster Care worker about the incident.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker
1 on 12/07/2023. Supervisor 1 recalled the part of the incident in
question where Youth A attempted to call authorities after the
restraint concluded. Supervisor 1 stated she offered the phone to
Youth A after dialing Centralized Intake, Youth A then became
aggressive again and attempted to fight her. Supervisor 1 stated
this was de-escalated without physical incident and Youth A did
not ask to call anyone afterwards.
Analysis Through interviews with youth and staff there was no evidence
found to support a rule violation. Youth A was afforded opportunity
to report allegations.
Consultation provided:
• The facility is advised that best practice in a situation like
this would be to ensure a non-involved staff member be the
one to facilitate a phone call with the escalated youth to
reduce the chance of further escalation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
